Key Match Events: Torkelson hit a home run after Jung's 10-pitch walk, connecting on a 93.4 mph fastball.
Maeda dodged trouble in his first two innings, then walked Jo Adell to lead off the fifth.
Jake Rogers picked the ball and fired a dart to Zach McKinstry, who applied the tag to end the inning.
Beau Brieske threw a 98.6 mph fastball past O'Hoppe's bat for strike three, the fastest pitch he has thrown all year.
Jason Foley slammed the door for his 19th save of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: A.J. Hinch praised Rogers' big play, saying it'saved his pitches for the next inning'.
Torkelson said the team needs to'stick with what we got' and keep playing hard, having fun, and pulling for one another.
Manager A.J. Hinch mentioned that teams start to press and lose character when they start tasting themselves and looking towards the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers won six in a row and 13 of their past 16 games, and are now only 4 1/2 games back from a wild-card spot with 28 games to play.
The team has not been this relevant this late in the year since 2016.
Rogers' play was crucial in helping the Tigers' pitcher, Maeda, settle in and dispatch three Angels hitters after the visit from his catcher.
The Tigers' win was their 13th in 16 games, and they are now looking to continue their improbable run in the American League standings.
